Name: Fragment of painted relief
Description: Fragment of limestone relief, with part of a hieroglyphic text, preserving the left half of three signs: the flat strip denoting 'land', the basket denoting 'all' or 'lord, and the loaf denoting the consonantal sound 't' (the feminine ending in Egyptian syntax), together perhaps part of the epithets of a goddess '... land (?) lady of ...' . This is part of the wall decoration in the temple to the cult of king Nebhepetra Mentuhotep, who reunited Egypt at the start of the Middle Kingdom c.2025 BC.
